description: The round payoff this round was 88. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 44.
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) maximizes individual and joint payoffs
The game has two Nash equilibria: mutual cooperation (1,1) and mutual defection (2,2), with the former being Pareto-efficient
Unilateral defection (choosing 2 when the other chooses 1) results in a lower individual payoff than mutual cooperation, removing the incentive to defect
Repeated rounds with revealed actions enable trust-building and coordination on the optimal equilibrium
The payoff structure resembles a stag hunt, prioritizing coordination over defection
